pullRequest.title: Update EIP-1559 implementation according to the latest changes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net
Co-authored-by: Karim TAAM karim.t2am@gmail.com
PR description


Add cli option --Xeip1559-migration-duration-in-blocks


Fix Clique consensus issue


renamed DECAY_RANGE to MIGRATION_DURATION_IN_BLOCKS


removed TARGET_GAS_USED, SLACK_COEFFICIENT and PER_TRANSACTION_LIMIT


updated computeBaseFee method to use target gas used depending on block number rather than the hard coded limit


added targetGasUsed method to compute the actual target gas used depending on the block number to manage correctly the transition period


updated gas budget calculator logic


updated block header validation rule to check the base fee based on the computed target gas used


updated test accordingly


Test performed

Test sync on Goerli
Test local Clique Network without EIP1559
Test on the clique testnet 1559

commit.message:
Update EIP-1559 implementation

- renamed `DECAY_RANGE` to `MIGRATION_DURATION_IN_BLOCKS`
- removed `TARGET_GAS_USED`, `SLACK_COEFFICIENT` and `PER_TRANSACTION_LIMIT`
- updated `computeBaseFee` method to use target gas used depending on block number rather than the hard coded limit
- added `targetGasUsed` method to compute the actual target gas used depending on the block number to manage correctly the transition period
- updated gas budget calculator logic
- updated block header validation rule to check the base fee based on the computed target gas used
- updated test accordingly

Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta <abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net>

fixed unit test

nodes.bodyText: Unless this is a standard (or standards track) API I think we should either take it out of the eth_ namespace (debug_ or an new one) or make it obviously bogus, like  eth_x_batchSendRawTransaction

What happens when one transaction in the middle would fail the addLocalTransaction call? Or the decode call? Did the TXes all before get processed OK?  Do the TXes after it it still get added?  Should we return success count and failure count?  Return errors with indexes?  A black hole concerns me.
Perhaps we stop at the first error.  All prior TXes are submitted and we send an error response including the index of the error and the error.  This may involve changing this to a traditional for loop.

commit.message:
Merge pull request #18 from matkt/feature/EIP-1559-Fix-testnet-issues-part2

- Update eip1559 Pool and Legacy pool part based on the last version of the EIP (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559). there was also a problem converting long to int which made the value invalid
- Update BlockTransactionSelector to use the transactionGasBudgetCalculator in order to fix the second part of the illegal block mined issue (Transaction processing error: transaction gas limit 21000 exceeds available block budget remaining XXX)
- We had an issue calculating gasUsed at the AbstractBlockProcessor level. We must have a separate counter for eip1559 and Legacy transactions because they have different pools
- Add check to verify that gasPrice is not less than the current BaseFee
- Add missing block header validator for Clique network

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM karim.t2am@gmail.com

remove batch send raw transaction JSON RPC method
